1. Adenomatous polyps: This is a type of benign growth that can develop on the inner lining of the large intestine or rectum. It is a precancerous condition, meaning that it increases the risk of developing colorectal cancer.
2. Colorectal cancer: This is a type of cancer that affects the colon or rectum. It is a serious disease that can lead to symptoms such as abdominal pain, diarrhea, constipation, and blood in the stool.
3. APC (Adenomatous Polyposis Coli) gene: This is a tumor suppressor gene that is mutated in some cases of familial adenomatous polyposis, a condition characterized by the development of numerous adenomatous polyps in the colon and rectum. The I1307K polymorphism is a variant of this gene.
